metadata.title: CVE-2015-20107 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In Python (aka CPython) up to 3.10.8, the mailcap module does not addescape characters into commands discovered in the system mailcap file. Thismay allow attackers to inject shell commands into applications that callmailcap.findmatch with untrusted input (if they lack validation ofuser-provided filenames or arguments). The fix is also back-ported to 3.7,3.8, 3.9

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-20107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
python2.7-examples - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
python3.6-examples - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.8').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.8').
python3.7 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
python3.8 package in bionic is affected and needs fixing.
